website_summaries.verdict: Precision art tablet with large drawing area, which comes with a carrying case and artist's glove.
pros: Excellent pen pressure sensitivity of 8192 levels lends ease and accuracy
8 customizable shortcuts available for each user
Tablet surface feels like paper, for a more "real drawing" experience
Compatible with mainstream digital art software
Comes with carrying bag and artist's glove
cons: Aside from some buyers having problems getting the drivers installed on their computer, the tablet works quite well, especially for the low price

customer_reviews.title: Unlimited Creativity
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old daughter asked for the Huion H610 Graphic Drawing Tablet to replace a Wacom tablet that didn’t work properly and needed a pen replacement, which was absurdly expensive. She’s a skilled artist and we needed a tablet that was durable and creatively expansive. Not another tech tool to gather dust!! She sold me on the tablet and the price, which was more than fair. She’s been drawing daily since we got the tablet months ago. It’s amazing!! And her drawings are blowing my mind!!
customer_reviews.author: D.Mo

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for artist
customer_reviews.text: One I got the tablet I noticed it came with everything described witch is great. The size is amazing for the price and delivery time was extremely fast. I had to un install my old wacom tablet driver before I was able to use this one but that took only 10 mins to do. And after getting use to the way this one works everything seems to be fine and actually works better for me now. My digital art has become very stylish and sexy. I absolutely love this tablet I highly recommend any new artist to invest in this. Because for that price and how much you get you wont beat that deal anywhere around!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah and eric

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet for awhile now, and needless to say, I am very satisfied with it's quality. I am a high school student with a passion for art, and I decided that I wanted to try out digital art with the hope of making this hobby into a career. The tablet was very easy to use, even for a newbie like me, and I got comfortable with using it in no time. Though this was my first drawing tablet, I felt that it was definitely high-quality for the price. Also, all the little bonuses were quite nice. I would highly recommend this tablet to all you artists out there.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Great for students and graphic designer. If you're on the fence, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. He is currently an graphic designer and student. This product works great with the programs he uses. This tablet works well with Adobe creative cloud. This includes photoshop. Projects that would have taken him hours to draw and edit by hand, now take significantly less time and effort. This tablet has greatly improved his productivity. I have two other hurion drawing tablets, but they were VERY entry level. If you're looking for something that will meet your needs and be budget friendly, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: We both loved how easy it was to set up and begin ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my son who has already received school awards for his hand drawings/illustrations. We both loved how easy it was to set up and begin using this tablet. Within minutes he was learning to create animations and began showing them to us on screen. The size of the screen was much larger than we expected and the sensitivity of the pen was amazing. My husband and I wanted to try using it, but my son has not given us a chance since he loves using it so much. I especially loved the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jowi

customer_reviews.title: Small Wacom vs. Huge Huion Tablet?
customer_reviews.text: The price is absolutely unbeatable. Mine came with replacement nubs, a glove, a pen stand, and a thin sleeve for the tablet. In terms of drawing, it's not as smooth and sensitive as the traditional Wacom; the actual quality of the tablet really just doesn't compare. However, if you're a student, it's preferable to buy this instead of a similarly-priced tiny Wacom tablet. Huion's tablet is certainly usable, and having the extra space is so much better for large screens and detail work.
customer_reviews.author: forest fox

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE PIECE OF SH*T
customer_reviews.text: This tablet does not work. I watched 3 instruction videos, installed it 50 times, and restarted my computer multiple times just to find that the tablet still would not work. I called the company and let the phone ring for 10 full minutes and nobody ever picked up. None of the buttons work and some of the instructions in the manual don't even match the product. Terrible. I called Amazon and got a full refund. Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: MARGARET EMY

customer_reviews.title: The tablet works great but I really don't like it
customer_reviews.text: The tablet works great but I really don't like it. I have a lot of trouble looking on the screen while I draw, I like to see what I am drawing and where the pencil is. I can't fault Huion, its a good product and works as intended. I just wish I could afford one of the ones that have a screen!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Good but some things...
customer_reviews.text: I like this tablet! It’s my first one ever and it’s easy enough to use and work around. I do think it should come with a separate booklet with suggestive apps to use it with or how to configure some of the buttons because I didn't see that in the instruction manual it came with. I’ve had trouble getting the tablet buttons to work and understanding what the pen buttons do. But the screen and pen itself are very responsive and the sketch pad feature is nice but probably should try another program because sketch pad is....faulty. Overall nice tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie T

customer_reviews.title: like this drawing pad
customer_reviews.text: I am not a superuser or professional when it comes to drawing tablet, and not certain how this is comparing to Wacom Bamboo tablets or other more expensive ones. I used it to help me be more precise when I do Photoshop editing and it works really well. I guess it would be even better if the drawing pad can connect through Bluetooth without having to use the USB cord.
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: Junk Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with an install disk for the drivers, the website in the instructions is not their website. None of the drivers online work. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tennill

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable
customer_reviews.text: This product has several problems. Like several others, I also experienced serious instabilities. Just moving the pen around without touching buttons caused Photoshop Elements to bounce around the various tools. Sometimes i couldn’t ever get it to draw at all, although the cursor would move ok. At one point, it would cause Photoshop elements to hang and even the mouse wouldn’t work. I had to use the force quit option on my Mac to close out the program. Another issue, is that there is no documentation on how to set up the program keys. It tells you how to enable the keys, but not how to load them with instructions. I intend to return the unit and try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Bradley

customer_reviews.title: I don’t find it beginner friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been able to successfully get the program open and I’ve tried on the MacBook and PC. I wish I returned it in the 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: K P

customer_reviews.title: I bought this tablet couple days ago and it works ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet couple days ago and it works perfectly,but today the pen failed to work. I tried to restart my laptop three time but the curser still stuck at the corner and the pen get no response.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Can't even use
customer_reviews.text: I can't even use this on ANY of the computers or laptops in my house. I waited too long to try it out and I can't even return it now. It's terrible and even on their site it claims there is problems downloading the driver to your computer. Don't buy this, save your money for a tablet that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in photoshop and illustrator.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tablet primarily for photoshop CC and it works really well. While I’m not a professional graphic designer, it has made it much easier to create new designs in illustrator. The precision is definitely what I would expect from a much more expensive tablet. I would try this for sure before dumping a pile of money on the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the Q&A from Huion and some of the comments. DOES NOT work with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I have the latest kernel on MX and have asked Digimends for help. Did everything I was told to do, and I am an ex-SA and know how to install software, drivers, etc. Never could get MX 18.3 to recognize the tablet, pen, etc. , so I have no idea why people are saying it works with Linux...unless they're using an old kernel. I was told to contact service@huiontable.com. No response from them, either. Getting ready to send it back. Their loss, not mine.
customer_reviews.author: mollypencanobie

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product, but NOT GOOD FOR EXTRA-WIDE MONITORS
customer_reviews.text: Tablet works well and is well worth the money. HOWEVER, the accompanying software is fundamentally flawed if you have an extra-wide monitor. You can adjust the onscreen work area to the same ratio as the tablet, leaving some nice side space for reference or other windows, BUT the X axis will be far more sensitive than the Y (drawn circles will become ovals) and there's nothing to remedy this unlike on higher end tablets. The ONLY solution to fix this axis sensitivity issue is an option in the settings which disables about a 3rd of the tablet's drawing space. So basically have an overly sensitive X axis or lose the use of a 3rd of your tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Comrade Smartass

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tablet for aspiring artists or established ones!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet! I've been wanting to upgrade from my Wacom Bamboo Touch tablet for YEARS but could never find an affordable tablet. Then I found this one! My art improved quality from all the variances in pressure detection that this new one has, and I love the bigger drawing space! It came in a nice drawstring bag with many accessories, including a drawing glove and a base for the pen with more nibs inside! Overall, I am VERY happy with this tablet, and it's a great buy for aspiring artists, established artists, or anyone in between.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Never been able to use...
customer_reviews.text: This company needs to be more specific in product description! I bought this as a Christmas present for my Daughter and it ended up being a huge disappointment! I was under the impression that it was a "regular" tablet that had a few specific elements geared towards drawing, but no. You have to also have a computer to connect it to to use it. I would've bought her something completely different had I known this. She's never been able to use it and her Christmas was quite disappointing. Can't really rate it's function or capabilities because it's never been used.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: So it worked perfectly fine at first. But its less then 2 months later and the tablet has developed a 3x3 inch area in the middle where it does not respond to my pen. It's super annoying when drawing comic panels. I've only release four comics from this tablet, and that's it. It really was not even that heavily used :(
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Broken stylus. Disappointing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to install and use but in less than 20 hours of use, and still under warranty the nib constantly falls out of the stylus and will not stay in. The nib is not worn out with so little use but is impossible to use when it falls out. I contacted huion directly and this was their response. “Thank you for your message. Unfortunately I can not help you with any support under the warranty of the product. We support purchases through our webshop”
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Hedquist

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with what I got
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this tablet, I did lots of research. I was struggling getting a direct drawing tablet or using computer's screen to draw. The latter is much cheaper and affordable. I am designer, have hobbies to design products. I don't need a professional drawing tablet. So I decided go for this one. This tablet is very easy to use, have a good pressure sense, but I never used other tablet before, so these comments maybe a little subjective. I feel as long as you train yourself get used to draw on tablet while watching on the PC screen. This product is very stable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zhangfulan

customer_reviews.title: Website wont open to download software
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my daughter, but I cant open the website to download the software. I tried to access the site from our laptop, as well as my Note 8, and it says the page is not found.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Craft

customer_reviews.title: For the price? Excellent choice to start off with.
customer_reviews.text: Great choice to get accustomed to digital art. However, chances are that later down the line, you'll be looking towards getting a more professional one that can take a video feed. In the meantime, this is the perfect choice for practicing and honing your craft. Be wary that the drivers included in the disk may not be the most effective. You'll probably have to go to Huion's website and find the appropriate driver installation for the H610 Pro model.
customer_reviews.author: Rad BB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for drawing!
customer_reviews.text: this was a nice tablet for drawing! the pen was smooth, the buttons worked (after having to install the drivers twice) and it worked for Krita and Firealpaca. the downside was that after a single year, I plugged it in and it didn't work. i didn't understand why it didn't come on, but I honestly did not expect it to last this long. but I hope it can be fixed 😒 overall, it was good for its money.
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is just right. It is not too expensive, but pricey enough to be good quality. It feels so smooth when drawing, it is like having a real pencil/pen/brush. I love how responsive it is, and how many pressure levels it has. If you have never used a drawing surface before, it is completely different and changes everything in your art. It is so fun I can just sit there for hours and create.
customer_reviews.author: S Boy P

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, wife loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my wife (pencil/paint medium artist), and she has yet to put it down after 2 weeks. She needs to eat at some point, right? UPDATE: I tried to put a pizza (HER FAVORITE) down in front of her, and she just let the dog take it after about a 2 hour painstaking test of discipline for the poor pooch. I'm amazed really that she made it as long as she did before she took it, but now I've got to deal with a dog with a belly full of bread, and garlic... Look for my next update within the reviews on puppy antacids.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tablet, works like a charm for certain programs. However, Photoshop works horribly with this tablet. All drivers were uninstalled, and i have installed the correct huion driver for this tablet and still messes up constantly in photoshop. But, this tablet works absolute wonders in Painttool Sai v. 1 and 2. I do commissions for a lot of people online ( a majority of my consumers are actually furries suprisingly ) the photo i linked to this review is actually one of my commissions i did with this tablet via paintool sai v.2 English isn't my first language, so please excuse my mess ups lol
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Whisenant

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my first graphics tablet so I'm still learning all the functions to it. I was wondering what the ruler was for, then realized the numbers are actually hotkeys. Setup was a breeze and I've been using this in photoshop and illustrator almost everyday for a couple months now. Still satisfied with the product and never had any problems with it yet.
customer_reviews.author: LucidWays

customer_reviews.title: Once connected, worked fine
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult at first to translate tablet drawing to the computer, but once you get used to it, it is not that bad. Getting the drivers set up was a little annoying , but eventually I got it to work. There is a long comment on here that explains it better than the company does. Basically go to the site and get the drivers for your operating system. Run and you should be good to just plug in and control your screen.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Makes photo and graphics editing much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to use. Requires a slight learning curve. Set the sensitivity to the higher setting. Allows you to move the cursor with the stylus while keeping it above the surface of the pad. When you need to edit just touch the stylus to the pad surface and edit your picture. This saves the life of the stylus tips and allows a lighter touch to your editing. The factory settings are not sensitive enough and I found myself pressing pretty hard on the surface and wearing the stylus tip. After changing the sensitivity I love the product and use it for all my drawing and editing.
customer_reviews.author: Tami D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students
customer_reviews.text: I am a college student. I have owned a nice wacom tablet before and have access to the most recent cintiqs at my school. This tablet was great for its price. Has some weird quirks here and there. Like the pen has a cap for some reason lol and i'm not sure what to do with this glove. However, this works great. Now I dont have to go to the studio to get my work done. Yes, every once in a while it will freeze but its totally worth it and expected with the price. I'd say this is a great transition tablet for beginners before they spend more money on a better one!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Teen daughter LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: Huion H610 Pro Graphic Drawing Tablet is easy to use. Got this for thirteen y.o. as Christmas present. She hooked it up without my help. Within minutes she was drawing. She even figured out the animation aspect of frame by frame 2D art. Absolutely fascinating to watch her put everything into action. This tablet is obviously easy for a teen to install and use within minutes. I don't even recall her using the manual since it was easy enough to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Primeshopfam

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tablet for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I am a musician who designs his own album artwork and concept work. In addition, I work extensively in VFX and Blender. This tablet for the money is VERY universally useable and has very good touch sensitivity. The pen has good weight to it and does not feel light at all. The touch buttons on the tablet are all fully customizable and can be set to mean different shortcuts which is incredibly useful when working in Design Programs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tablet-a-licious
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price of kit, comparable with tablets double the price. My only gripe is that I cannot figure out how to use the pen and/or tablet to easily zoom in on my location. But that's a user issue, not that of the product. If you (or someone you know) is looking to getting into digital art and design, then you can safely purchase this tablet knowing that they will be using it for a good time to come!
customer_reviews.author: DrWhodini

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Really good sensitivity, very good accuracy, and very fun to use. Its not difficult to figure out how to use and, comes with instructions. Works with many drawing software and I have not had any issues. I only had one issue with slight input lag, but the problem went away shortly after it happened and hasn't come up again. I would definitely recommend this to beginners, and non beginners. Simply a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Shel J.

customer_reviews.title: Artistic kid loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: It took my kid months to even touch this because she was afraid of transition from manual to technical. BUT when she finally used it, she loved it. She makes wonderful art with characters that have no limit. It has taught her to get better, and while she still uses paper from time to time, this is good to prepare for the digital world as an aspiring artist. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Damaged1

customer_reviews.title: Stick with a Wacom.
customer_reviews.text: This tablet's awful. I thought I would take a chance on a budget tablet but now really regret it. Installed the driver and the settings are worthless/don't work. This was on a new professional PC desktop, so maybe it would work better on a different OS. In the past I had a Wacom and it spoiled me. Going back to the tried and true brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet works as advertised. The pressure sensitivity is smooth and the partial glove that comes with it really does help your hand glide when drawing lines that require you to move your whole hand/arm. The only thing I didn't research, and this is totally on me, is that it doesn't detect the angle of the stylus. I was planning on using this for digital paining which I'll still do, but that's one less type of dynamic control handled by the tablet that the competition has. That said, I've owned competing products that were much more expensive and this suits my needs very well. Also great for photo touch-ups for fine work.
customer_reviews.author: new england guy

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, great price for a good tablet
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a very similar tablet from monoprice. As my first tablet it was cheap and got the job done, but there were issues. This tablet draws so smoothly, the nub practically glides across the surface. The pen is easy to use and has a great charge life, no replacing batteries. Setup was simple, I just had to download the drivers, which were easy to find with just a google search. I also like it’s size. It’s a larger tablet than some I have seen but I enjoy a larger surface to work with. All in all I believe this is an excellent purchase for the price, and despite being an older model it works fantastically.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Merchant

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bamboo.
customer_reviews.text: so far I've tried a WACOM Bamboo tablet, and this HUION tablet. and I have to say that I absolutely love this tablet more. Every control is intuitive, the brush strokes and pen sensitivity are on point, and it pairs well with my software. I haven't put it under heavy wear yet since I don't yet have a screen protector, but I absolutely love this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.

customer_reviews.title: Isn't working as it's supposed to. Seller is sending a replacement due to malfunctioning tablet
customer_reviews.text: The Huion tablet's buttons don't work and the pen pressure isn't working either. It doesn't sense when I'm pressing really hard with the pen or not pressing at all. I had the Huion H420, and it worked better in all ways than this tablet: it was cheaper, the pen pressure worked, and the buttons (even though there were three) worked. Unfortunately, the Huion H420 stopped working after a week, so maybe it's just a Huion thing. However, Huion has been responsive and are sending me a replacement product at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Anjit Fageria

customer_reviews.title: Super User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Tablet is good for a beginner like me, easy to install, and the use is even easier The only downside i have is the undo key is hard to press almost in comparison to the rest of the key ... They even have a little click to thwm except for the undo key... I guess mine came with a factory defect, nothing that a Ctrl + Z can't fix
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Alternative that works better than we could have imagined
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife when her old Wacom finally but the dust. Thought we were buying it as a budget hold over for now. Ends up it is a fantastic unit and she really loves it! I'm sure we'll upgrade to something "awesomer" later on, but I'm so happy she has something that works this well for this price to do her work with.
customer_reviews.author: John McHaffie

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if we got a dud but not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an anniversary gift for my boyfriend. He was SO EXCITED because this is the only thing he has talked about for months! So sad that it’s not working properly. He has decided to give it one more try, if it doesn’t work, it will be going back in the morning. I think it has potential, unfortunately it wasn’t working for us.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Complicated to install . NEEDS CLEAR HELPFUL installation instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to install . the website has so many options for all the PC s and devices to install / download it to BUT it's confusing and dpesnt give clear easy to understand instructions of WHICH to CHOOSE to download and we still aren't sure if we downloaded the correct version ( i think its 32 or 64 bit is the issue )
customer_reviews.author: MdewakantonMommy09

customer_reviews.title: Noice
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I use this with the free application Krita and I love it. I have no previous drawing experience and this is nice and easy to use. I gave it 4 instead of 5 only because when I first used it, I found out it was compatible with the software Citrix, which my school uses as an intermediary piece of software for using school copies of Illustrator and Photoshop. Because of this lack of compatibility I had to use Krita instead. which is sufficient but not ideal. The table itself is great, easy to use. Perfect for beginers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with certain programs and buggy
customer_reviews.text: This isn't really compatible with Firealpaca or Paint Tool Sai for me. Even when using it with Medibang or Clip Studio Paint, it is just super buggy and it's not an easy fix for someone who doesn't know how to work computer files. I'm going to keep it though, because I'm not that professional and just like to doodle on online programs like Aggie.io with my friends. Anyway, if you do professional art, don't buy this if you don't want to deal with a potential exporting issue. *Potential* because not everyone has this problem. If you want something cheap like this tablet, I suggest an Ugee. I used to have one and it worked fine, at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: cornhat

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: The hotkeys and the size of the tablet were overall more than we expected for the price. The accuracy is very precise and installation was fairly easy. We had some trouble with the install pausing and eventually failing, however I believe this was related to Windows defender. Once I paused some software walls, it seemed to work no issues and was recognized by Photoshop immediately.
customer_reviews.author: S. Boyajian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price and works great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My daughter loves it. I can’t believe how good she is drawing using this. She has always wanted a tablet and wanted a Wacom but the price of those plus the negative reviews made me look elsewhere. This is perfect and works great. I bought her an acre aspire e15 to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sexy MAN

customer_reviews.title: stuttering, inconsistent. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: this is unusable and a big waste of money, DO NOT BUY. very frequently, when the pen hit the pad it wouldnt register. there is this annoying circle that appears to show you where your pen is, when it is still on the pad that totally screws with the strokes you take. instead of a solid line you will get a dotted one. i couldnt use it there was no telling whether or not it would behave properly. WASTE OF MONEY DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: skeleton goullee

customer_reviews.title: Never worked - never got support
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t work - I’ve used many pads before but all it did was create dots. When I tried to contact the company they never responded and then COVID came and they didn’t even have support.
customer_reviews.author: BaronVonEngelhafen

customer_reviews.title: Needs a software upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Software isn’t great. Got this for my son and he even said the quality wasn’t great. His pictures weren’t pixelated very well for the drawing he wanted to do. Basic drawings like simple lines is what it’s best used for.
customer_reviews.author: Des71025

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I quite like this tablet. the driver has nice functionality. I like being able to set the screen drawing size. The pressure sensitivity works fine in the art program I do illustrations in. (I use Affinity Designer.) The only thing I don't like is how easy it is to bump the buttons on the pen when drawing. I wish they required more pressure to push, so to save myself some frustration I disabled them in the driver.
customer_reviews.author: D West

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: When this pad worked, it was easy to use. However, it stopped working one year to the date purchased. Unfortunately the warranty is for one year. So I'm without a drawing pad. It isn't worth the money for only one year of moderate use. Pass it by--Don't recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Jereda Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great for people who want to get into graphic design but don’t have the money to blow on a top end graphics tablet like a Wacom. It has pretty good pressure gauging for drawing lines and allows you to see where you are about to place your pen (for those wondering). It doesn’t come with the software to draw in so I’d recommend looking into some open source applications.
customer_reviews.author: Trainer Sarah ♀

customer_reviews.title: Pen Only works when plugged in : Updated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement last week. The overall quality of the product seems good however I cannot use the pen without it being plugged in. This is obviously not optimal. I do not want to return the whole thing, but I need a working pen. Customer service what do you suggest? UPDATE: They sent me a new pen within a few days and it works as it should. Thank you for excellent customer Service!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Cauble

customer_reviews.title: Quality tablet for those starting.
customer_reviews.text: New to drawing digital. I bought this at 60 dollars during a flash sale and I have used it for hours after my purchase. The functionality and customizable buttons on the tablet and pen are nice as a beginner. The location of the buttons on the pen could cause accidental misclicks though. The package I ordered came with an artist glove, I personally have not experienced an issue with my hand getting stuck, so i haven't had much use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Faulty drivers and bad compatibility
customer_reviews.text: The tablet overall seems okay, but that's only if you can get the thing working. The real issue is in the software. The drivers are faulty and outdated, so they don't even work with Windows 10, and it takes too much time and effort to make it work properly. You're better off picking up a Wacom tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Aspiring artist's dream!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my aspiring artist daughter. It has been wonderful! It easily integrates with any software, it has great tough sensitivity. She loves it. Great for the price. I would order again!
customer_reviews.author: bridgesbaker

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and good quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really nice tablet, a lot bigger than I thought it would be which is great. Mine didn’t come with extra nibs for the pen which the booklet it comes with said it would have but there was none :/ it’s gonna take some time getting used to but that’s what practice is for after all. The installation was also very easy
customer_reviews.author: hanafruit

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: Just like he wacom tablet. Works well and took my editing game up a ton!
customer_reviews.author: KalvinStein

customer_reviews.title: Best drawing tablet for the price on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product, I’ve had mine for roughly around 4 months or so and I use it for all my digital art needs, the layout is spacious and it feels so natural to me, the pen sensitivity is great and I’d recommend this to any artist looking to grab yourself a drawing tablet, I’ve made twitch emotes aswell as commissions for clients and it’s easy to use application makes this one of the top products for new or seasoned artists. I will be looking to get a canvas pro 13 soon and try it out aswell.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Sykes

customer_reviews.title: Great, but fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter, she likes it, no complaints or needing help install anything. Pretty much works as it should. Screen cracked after about a 2ft fall from a bed to a carpet, so I guess be careful? Not sure about the screen replacement I'm about to go look up, but hopefully cheap and actually available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for begginers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter drawing tablet for my daughter's birthday, I thought drawing without being about to see your drawing on the surface would be easy.... it's not as easy as I assumed. The setup is fairly simple but the nuanced features are a bit much for a beginner in my opinion, especially if the person isn't VERY experienced with whatever graphics program. Over all I should have just bought one with the built in screen which is what I just did.
customer_reviews.author: humberto miranda

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It worked well enough but the pressure sensitivity and the buttons did not work for my laptop. Not sure if it was a setting issue but a decent enough starting tablet for digital drawing otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some lag. Region selection (crop) in configuration doesn't do anything.
customer_reviews.text: Positive experience overall. But there's a bit of lag (latency) comparing to mouse. Also I couldn't set the resolution of the tablet to match the resolution of the screen so that drawing 1 inch on the tablet would draw 1 inch on the screen as well. In Windows 7 the UI of the tablet configuration seems to have region selection option, but it doesn't affect the actual area on the screen. The tablet always controls the whole screen.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bessmertniy

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet, good price
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first tablet. I've had it for 3 1/2 month's and it's been a joy to use. Easy to learn, easy to set up and super easy to change and set up hot keys. The pen charges quickly. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because every now and again while drawing the line goes a bit jagged and zig zaggy, which usually means the pen needs to be charged. I wish there was a better indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre C

customer_reviews.title: So difficult to start
customer_reviews.text: I have the latest software and programs yet this would not load onto my computer. No numbers to call. Couldn't even load website after hours of trying. My daughter was heartbroken Christmas day when it wouldn't even let her draw anything. In this day and age, why would you make a product this difficult to use?
customer_reviews.author: teresa dalton

customer_reviews.title: Cant get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet, after a week, gotten the tablet to work right. My computer is failing to recognize the tablet, and software is responding to it but VERY poorly....to the point that it is unusable. If I apply pressure with the pen, and wait a few seconds, then start drawing, I can sometimes get Adobe Illustrator or Inkscape or Adobe Acrobat to record a stroke Most times a proper stroke is not recorded. Very annoying. Completely unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.author: Dave Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A.
customer_reviews.text: It never worked from day one. I thought maybe it was just my computer so I plugged it into my daughters and still nothing. I left it plugged in for hours thinking maybe it needed to be plugged in.. both the pen and the tablet. Still nothing. Of course I didn't get the chance to open the package until after the date I could not return it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Valerie gordon

customer_reviews.title: Works on Linux with some effort
customer_reviews.text: Its my first drawing tablet, and I couldn't be happier. It works with Linux, there's some great guides online on how to set it up. It takes a bit more effort than on say windows, but once it's set up it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: jake rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Wacom if you want a drawing tablet
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know if this is a good or a bad drawing tablet since I never could get it to connect to my Macbook Pro. Finally gave up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Howard

customer_reviews.text: My 13year old daughter loves to draw thought this would save paper. Took forever to install and way to many options and other things. I guess I assumed it was a simpler product. She wont use it because it's too complicated
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to learn
customer_reviews.text: This came extremely well packed, I found this a little difficult to start using since I had to coordinate where I was on the screen instead of on the pad. Features are cool, will take some getting use to but would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Experimenalist

customer_reviews.title: website down
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for Christmas. We could not download from Huion website. Their certificate is outdated. Also i got a message that something may be trying to steal my personal information? The next day the website won't even pull up. I call amazon. They tried calling Huion and no answer. They are having me return it. Amazon is great!
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I originally had a Wacom intuos, and that was great and all, but this tablet comes with more options for less. I honestly like this tablet more than my previous in all areas. The only thing I don’t like is the pen has to be charged, but the battery life lasts over a week. This is an over all great tablet
customer_reviews.author: Gremlin

customer_reviews.title: ... I have to say this was by far my best experience. I found the tablet to be both ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming off of a Bamboo tablet I have to say this was by far my best experience. I found the tablet to be both a natural felling physically and artistically. The only thing that may have been a hurtle was Not to the detriment of the tablet or the pen, but on the incorporation to the software I was using (Gimp) however once I figured it out I was at home. Thank you for this affordable yet great product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Whittington III

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, perfect for the young or old artist getting into digital art
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tablet. It’s the perfect size, and the install is super smooth. A pro tip for anyone having trouble getting the setup down, Huion tablets are pretty notorious for their drivers having issues off and on. If the newest version of the driver for your tablet doesn’t work, try download the second newest! That’s always worked for me! But otherwise this is a REALLY good tablet, especially for beginners starting out in digital art.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Although this was an "open box" item, it was just a small blemish on the packaging. The tablet was absolutely brand new and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Leiss

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old who wanted to start learning graphic design, just like his older brother. For the price, the Huion H610 can't be beat. It's amazingly accurate, easy to use, and everything is straightforward. My son LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Zenjiro K.

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift for my Daughter. If she loves it, I love it.
customer_reviews.text: She picked it up, tried it out, and loves it. It was priced right for what I was looking to spend on it. And, it seems reliable. As long as she loves it, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: The Buttons didn't work
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is great. Works well and is easy to set up. The only problem was the buttons didn't work. For the price I wasn't upset. It wasn't a big deal for me but it might be for you. The pen also works very well.
customer_reviews.author: courtney garis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed an affordable tablet for my computer graphics software. I had been a Huion user before, but was still not sure about this particular model. I was able to download the appropriate driver and get it working on my two monitors pretty quickly, and it worked well with both my Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator as well as my Open Source software like Krita and Blender. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drawing Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The drawing tablet is very spacious. their is plenty of room and it's like drawing on a regular book. The pressure sensitivity is excellent. I highly recommend this tablet to anyone looking to do digital drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Willis

customer_reviews.title: Good tabket
customer_reviews.text: This tablet works amazingly! To be honest I didn't expact much since it is such a cheap tablet. To my surprise, the sensitivity of this tablet is better than one of mt bamboo tablet. Although it looks big and ugly on the picture, the actual product is fairly light and presentable. The pen needs to charge,but it really isn't a big deal since it doesn't need long to charge it at all! Definitely 5 star for this one c: (I've used tjis for a while now, so far it hasn't break down yet lol)
customer_reviews.author: yilan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and learn
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing. I could not afford the Wacom so I thought I would never own a drawing tablet but a friend suggest this and it worked perfect! Takes no time to learn, and it becomes 2nd nature within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: We still have not been able to get this item to work! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: D.M.R

customer_reviews.title: Great quality drawing tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of getting to know the basics of most forms of digital art, and so far, I have no issues what so ever with this tablet. Very easy to hold, easy to use, easy setup, and it feels very fun to draw on! The pressure senstivity feels like butter, and it’s very fun to press down on the pad for varying line thicknesses. I’ve included my first work with the tablet, which happens to be an emblem for a friends startup company, which was drawn with Krita.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my 15 year old son. I'm impressed with how easily he managed to use it and how he's becoming efficient with its use to create his master pieces. Was delivered in a timely manner. No issues to date. He has been using it daily for months now.
customer_reviews.author: lucian pris

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Did everything we needed it to (purchased for a hybrid college course). Tricky to get the hang of, but that is to be expected with writing and drawing electronically (like signing for a credit or debit transaction would be). Practice for a little bit and it's not that bad!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee Paiva

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those cases where you get what you pay for. Lasted a few months with casual on and off use, then decided to just die. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling drivers to no avail. Just spend the money on a Wacom or similar.
customer_reviews.author: John DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: The highly sensitive pressure levels make a huge difference in my digital design. This tablet has helped me achieve a new level in creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Jase

customer_reviews.title: Pen Doesn't work - tried everything
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this. Packaging was nice, and looked like it would do what i needed. Despite all the good reviews, this product was garbage (at least my unit was). It is setting me back on a project now. I guess you get what you pay for. I'll be returning this right away....
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient to use
customer_reviews.text: The tablet was very easy to use, and quick to learn. I like the fact that I don't have to lift the pen off the tablet to move across the screen. I would recommend this Product to anyone who is an artist or an animator.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Bjalek

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and love the results
customer_reviews.text: My daughter researched this and paid for it with her birthday savings. She found it easy to use and loves the results. The software install was no problem. So far we are both very happy with her choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drivers are a bit buggy but overall it works fine. Pressure sensitivity with the pen is fantastic and ...
customer_reviews.text: Drivers are a bit buggy but overall it works fine. Pressure sensitivity with the pen is fantastic and smooth. The drawing surface is a bit slick but I have gotten used to it. I used this tablet for a custom graphics job and was impressed with how well it worked. For the price you can't do better!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those learning to do digital art
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for what I need and great for the price. I'm currently teaching myself how to do digital art and learning how to use both the tablet and the software, but overall a great product. My only complaint is that I'm left handed and therefore had to turn the tablet upside down to be able to use the shortcut buttons. It's not intuitive to learn what the buttons do while looking at the symbols upside down. Nevertheless I'll get the hang of it in time.
customer_reviews.author: J.Kuykendall

customer_reviews.title: A very nice tablet, well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I find this tablet very nice! My only complaint is that sometimes, even when fully charged, the pen will just stop working. This is easily solved by closing up the art program I'm using (Saving my art beforehand, of course) and then reopening it again, and then suddenly the pen starts to work just fine. Other than that, this tablet is great. :)
customer_reviews.author: blue

product_meta.title: Huion H610 Pro Graphic Drawing Tablet 8192 Pen Pressure Sensitivity with Carrying Bag and Glove
feature_bullets: 8192 Pen Pressure Sensitivity - Every stroke you drawn is accurate and efficient.
8 User-defined Shortcuts - The drawing tablet is convenient to set up your favorite shortcuts according to your own needs.
Sufficient Compact Working Area - The large working surface of 10×6.25 inches provides users with larger space to draw, bringing users a more enjoyable working experience of the digital tablet.
Smooth Paper-like Texture - The paper-like surface of the graphic tablet provides users with a more natural and realistic experience, just like drawing on the real paper.
Compatibility - The art tablet is compatible with Windows 7 or later, Mac OS 10.11 or later and mainstream digital art software.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars850 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
